Class Bookshelf

model.Bookshelf

public class Bookshelf extends Object implements Serializable
Abstraction of the physical shelf of MyShelfie

    getScoreEOG()

    int
    getScoreGroups()
    The aim of this method is to calculate the points scored by creating groups of adjacent tiles in the matrix The data structures used are a list of queues and an additional matrix The additional matrix is used to track which tiles in the matrix has been already visited during the research of groups The queue saves all the groups found so it can be easy to count the size of it and so calculate the points dued to it Groups are found through a recursive function "recursive_checker()" which inspect all the adjacent tiles of the same type

      public PersonalGoalCard getPgc()

    • putTiles

      public boolean putTiles(ArrayList<Tile> stream_tiles, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidLenghtException, InvalidChoiceException
      Parameters:
      stream_tiles - When the player draw the tiles from the deck they are setted into an array ; The position of the tiles in the array is the order on which the player will insert the card on the column: stream_tiles lenght must be more than 0 and less than 3
      column - The player must specifies which column he wants to put the tiles in
      Returns:
      always true if the operation is correct, in all other cases an exception in thrown
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException
      InvalidLenghtException
      InvalidChoiceException

    • getShelf

      public Tile[][] getShelf()
      Feedback method, it shows the element of the matrix in order to render the whole matrix on the CLI

    • maxShelfSpace

      public int maxShelfSpace()
      Returns:
      this method returns the number of max free spaces for all the columns of the shelf

    • getMyScore

      public int getMyScore()
      Returns:
      sum of all the points accumulated by the player during the game

    • getScoreGroups

      public int getScoreGroups()
      The aim of this method is to calculate the points scored by creating groups of adjacent tiles in the matrix The data structures used are a list of queues and an additional matrix The additional matrix is used to track which tiles in the matrix has been already visited during the research of groups The queue saves all the groups found so it can be easy to count the size of it and so calculate the points dued to it Groups are found through a recursive function "recursive_checker()" which inspect all the adjacent tiles of the same type
      Returns:
      return statement returns the point scored by the creation of all the groups of the matrix

    • checkCG1

      public void checkCG1()
      assign the tokenCG1 if it has been completed

    • checkCG2

      public void checkCG2()
      assign the tokenCG2 if it has been completed

    • getScoreCGC

      public int getScoreCGC()
      Returns:
      return the points scored by completing common goal card goals

    • getScorePGC

      public int getScorePGC()
      Returns:
      return the point scored by completing personal goal card goal

    • checkEOG

      public boolean checkEOG()
      It has a double aim: 1. Indicates if someone has finished it's game (his/her matrix is all filled) 2. Indicated if the "owner" of this bookshelf has finished by filling all the gaps in the matrix ==> indicates is the game is still running or not
      Returns:
      true if game is ended, false if game is not ended

    • getScoreEOG

      public int getScoreEOG()
      If the player is the first one finishing to fill the matrix so it has the EOG token it'll assign him 1 extra point

      public Board getBoard()
